name: commissioned
content:
commissioned adjective
(MILITARY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
military
  specialized (of a member of the armed forces) having achieved the rank of officer by receiving a commission (= an official order) rather than by rising from the lower ranks: On leaving Cambridge he did his military service as a commissioned officer in the Royal Engineers. He was the first African-American to serve as a commissioned Navy officer. Compare
non-commissioned
More examplesFewer examplesUniversity graduates who enter the armed forces must still apply to become comissioned officers; it's not automatic.Squadron Leader is a commissioned rank in the Royal Air Force.

commissioned adjective
(WORK)
A commissioned piece of work has been formally asked for by someone in authority: The piece was choreographed by Twyla Tharp to a commissioned score by Elvis Costello. At the front of the building will be a specially commissioned sculpture. A commissioned study of healthcare needs across the region has not yet been completed.
A commissioned person has been formally asked to produce something by a person in authority: The accompanying pictures were drawn by a commissioned artist.
More examplesFewer examplesThe concert featured a commissioned work by the composer John Maxwell Geddes.

commissioned adjective
(PAYMENT)
A commissioned salesperson (= someone who sells things) receives payment that is directly related to the amount they sell: You're working with a commissioned salesperson who only stands to gain if he makes the deal.
